name: Pure Maple Candy
author: Islandgirlchef
summary: Pure, creamy, melt-in-your-mouth maple candy using only pure maple syrup! It's a treat almost like fudge. Add anything you want like chopped nuts. Use small maple leaf molds or other pretty shapes.
directions: In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, bring the maple syrup to a boil over medium-high heat stirring occasionally
Boil until syrup reaches 235 degrees F (110 degrees C) on a candy thermometer
Remove from heat and cool to 175 degrees F (80 degrees C) without stirring, about 10 minutes
Stir mixture rapidly with a wooden spoon for about 5 minutes until the color turns lighter and mixture becomes thick and creamy
Stir in chopped nuts, if desired
Store in airtight containers up to 1 month
